Name: CloudShell secrets file downloaded
Description: Review use of CloudShell. Permiso seldom witnesses use of CloudShell outside of known attackers.This however may be a part of your normal business use case.

Name: Diassociate a master account
Description: An attacker exploiting the DisassociateFromMasterAccount eventName might gain unauthorized access, escalate privileges, disrupt operations, manipulate or steal data, and potentially impersonate legitimate entities within the system.

Name: Enable Serial ConsoleAccess
Description: An attacker could potentially leverage 'EnableSerialConsoleAccess' to bypass regular security measures and gain unauthorized entry or control over a system through direct access to its serial console.

Name: GD DeleteInvitation
Description: An attacker could abuse 'DeleteInvitations' to remove pending invitations, potentially disrupting collaboration or eliminating traces of attempted or ongoing invitations within a system or platform.

Name: GD DeleteDetector
Description: An attacker might misuse 'DeleteDetector' to initiate unauthorized deletion operations within a system, potentially causing data loss or disruption.

Name: Replace Iam Instance Profile Association
Description: An attacker could potentially misuse 'ReplaceIamInstanceProfileAssociation' to substitute an existing IAM instance profile association, gaining unauthorized permissions or access to resources associated with that profile.

Name: Update Service Settings
Description: An attacker could misuse UpdateServiceSetting to change critical service configurations, potentially leading to misconfigurations that may impact the availability, reliability, or security of the service.

Name: Download Secrets from CloudShell
Description: An attacker could potentially exploit 'GetSecretValue.*exec-env/CloudShell' to access and retrieve sensitive secrets within the CloudShell execution environment, leading to unauthorized data exposure or misuse for malicious purposes.

Name: Cloudtrail Evasion
Description: If an attacker can stop logging, they might be able to perform malicious actions without leaving a trace in the logs. This makes it harder to identify and respond to security incidents.

Name: Cloudtrail Evasion
Description: An attacker could misuse DeleteTrail to tamper with or delete log entries, attempting to cover their tracks and evade detection by erasing evidence of their activities

Name: S3 Browser usage
Description: S3 Browser 9.5.5 usage can be an indicator of LUCR1 attack. Since this group preferes using older version of S3 Browser.

Description: Indicates potential usage of Legion for spam campaigns or unauthorized access.

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: Typical query searched by LUCR3 Threat Actor

Name: New-InboxRule
Description: Threat actors, including LUCR3, often use such commands to establish control over victim mailboxes. Research by Permiso highlights this as a common tactic in email compromise scenarios.

Name: Set-InboxRule
Description: Attackers may adjust rules to ensure persistence or stealth. LUCR3 activity, as tracked by Permiso, shows frequent use of this technique in prolonged intrusions.

Name: Set-TransportRule
Description: This detection covers changes to transport rules, which can be used to redirect or block emails at a broader level. LUCR3 has been observed by Permiso leveraging such methods for data exfiltration and communication control.

Name: New-TransportRule
Description: Attackers such as LUCR3 tend to manipulate email flow. Permiso research notes this as a significant indicator of malicious configuration changes.

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term 'okta_key', which may indicate reconnaissance or attempts to locate sensitive Okta-related information within SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches the term 'SNOWFLAKE' for Snowflake-related credentials or resources within SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term 'api.cloudflare.com' Cloudflare API references in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for SendGrid-related information in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for Shodan API keys or related data in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for vSphere administrator credentials in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches the term 'aws_access_key_id' for AWS access keys by LUCR-3 within SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for 'user database', potentially indicating attempts to access sensitive user data stored in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term 'confidential' in files or data in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs).

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for 'vault password' by LUCR-3 in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs)..

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for 'securestring' fields in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs)..

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term 'twilio_api_key' Twilio API keys in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs)..

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term 'crowdstrike_api' CrowdStrike API keys or configurations in SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs)..

Name: LUCR-3 Searches
Description: The query searches for the term '*AKIA*' AWS access keys (starting with 'AKIA') within SharePoint. Permiso actively tracks this search term to identify and mitigate LUCR-3(TTPs)..

Name: Gui-Vil Intel
Description: Potential IOC tied to Gui-Vil's cloud infrastructure exploitation.

Name: Gui-Vil Intel
Description: Suspicious activity associated with Gui-Vil's cloud operations.

Name: Obsidian Research SaaS Ransomware
Description: Indicator linked to Obsidian ransomware.

Name: Intel
Description: Generic indicator tied to unauthorized system-wide access.

Name: Venom_SMS
Description: Indicator of malicious SMS or email spoofing campaigns.

Name: TA
Description: Operational security artifact used by threat actors.

Name: TA
Description: Possible malicious S3 operation or abuse of AWS storage.

Description: Review use of CloudShell. Permiso seldom witnesses use of CloudShell outside of known attackers.This however may be a part of your normal business use case.

Description: Review use of CloudShell. Permiso seldom witnesses use of CloudShell outside of known attackers.This however may be a part of your normal business use case.
